isis.stitle: ALLISON WT TRANSMISSION ELECTRONIC CONTROLS - DESCRIPTION

svcsubsecinfo.para: The contents of this service manual section focus on International-installed components and wiring and how those components function as part of the transmission electronic control system. For more detailed information regarding the Allison WT transmission and the Allison supplied components that are part of the electronic control system, refer to the appropriate Allison service manuals.

The World Transmission (WT) is an electronically controlled transmission designed by Allison Transmission Division of General Motors Corporation. The WT Electronic Controls system consists of the following components:

item.para: *Shift Lever Selector And MODE Selector Button
· Diagnostic Data Link (Part Of The International Platform Harness)
· "DO NOT SHIFT LIGHT" Red Instrument Panel Light (Part Of International Instrument Cluster)

svcproc.title: ELECTRONIC CONTROL UNIT (ECU)
svcproc.para: The Electronic Control Unit (ECU) is a microcomputer, which is the brain of the transmission control system ( Figure 1). The ECU contains Electronically Erasable Programmable Read Only Memory (EEPROM), which is programmed by Allison with a shift calibration that reflects the specific transmission assembly, the vehicle engine, and customer selected package of "Spare Input and Output" options available for controlling additional vehicle components.
The ECU communicates with the vehicle electrical system and International-installed transmission control components through the Vehicle Interface Module (VIM) and the transmission harness.

item.para: The ECU also receives inputs from other components that are part of the Allison WT electronic control system ( Figure 2).

figure.caption: Figure 2 - Electronic Control Unit (ECU) Functions And Controls

svcproc.para: The ECU sends information to the vehicle electrical system controlling back-up light operation, prevents the vehicle engine from starting in any gear other than neutral, and provides the input signal to drive the vehicle's electronic speedometer. The ECU also is in direct communication with the Antilock Brake System Electronic Control Module (ECM) so that when the antilock system senses a wheel lockup condition is about to occur and modulates the brake system, the Allison WT control system senses this and will dis-engage the transmission lockup clutch (and will disengage a retarder if installed).
